page.title: 02Oxcars
page.content:
Oxcars is a small, rocky, uninhabited island in the Firth of Forth. It belongs to Fife Region and is in the parish of Aberdour.
There is a 5 fathom bank round Oxcars reaching west to a point north of Cramond. There is also a sand_bank extending to the east to a point midway north of Granton and Newhaven. There is a lighthouse on the island whose light is visible 12 miles away.
The "Ox" of the name is derived from the word "auk" (the sea_bird) and the "cars" is derived from "corraig" (Gaelic or Irish) or "carreg" (Welsh) meaning "sea_cliff" or "rock in the sea".
